driveFile.title: What Is the Point of Museums_ - The School Of Life.pdf

courseWork.title: What is the point of museums?
courseWork.description:
Expound on “What is the Point of Museums?” using the knowledge you have gained from this course. Draw insights
from your own interactions with museums and highlight how cultures are shaped through museums.

Choices for Museum Activities:
(a) "Memory of a Future: Panumduman sa Umaabot”Art Exhibit/ Joya Gallery/ 28 April – 05 May 2023
  - Also Artist Talk and Literary Night/ Joya Gallery/ 05 May 2023/ 6 PM
(b) Gabii sa Kabilin / participating museums and establishments in Cebu City/ 12 May 2023/ 6 PM – 12 MN

Essay Specifics:
1. Length: no limit
2. Paper size: 8.5” x 11”
3. Spacing: single space
4. Margin: one inch all around

courseWork.title: MODULE 2: Engagement Activity 2 - Visual Elements - Nuggets
courseWork.description:
How does the interrelationship of line, color, value, shape, movement, and other elements bring about the intellectual and/ or  emotional experience in the short animated film “Nuggets,” written and directed by  Andreas Hykade and animated by Andreas Hykade and Angela Steffen. Write your own reaction or interpretation.

“Nuggets” is available in YouTube. Check the link:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HUngLgGRJpo

Specifics for the essay/ interpretation
1. Length:
2. Paper size of the Word document: 8.5” x 11”
3. Spacing: single space
4. Margin: one inch all around

Deadline:
15 June 2023 (End of classes)

courseWork.title: MODULE 2: Engagement Activity 1-Visual Element Grid
courseWork.description:
Individual/ Collaborative Work (maximum of 3 people)

Materials: 
* Oslo paper (layout: landscape; margins not required), drawing & coloring materials of your choice 
OR
* Digital art may also be done. 

Instructions:

Through a grid of eight (8) panels, creatively illustrate the visual elements in the following order (left to right): 
(a) upper row - line, shape, mass, color
(b) lower row - value, intensity, space, texture (pattern)
[Fine! You may rearrange the elements. Just make sure that the elements are complete.]

Make use of a unifying element to connect the 8 panels.
Reminder: No need to label panels.

For digital submission: Indicate name/s, course and year, and class schedule.
For actual paper submission: Indicate name/s, course and year, class schedule, and date of submission at the back portion of the paper.

Deadline: 
15 June 2023 (End of classes)
